medical_history.chief_complaint: Right occipital pain radiating anteriorly and deterioration in vision.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with right occipital pain and vision deterioration. The headache started to improve after sirolimus was withdrawn, and visual acuity was noted to improve three months later.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Recipient of a single lung transplant 2 years prior to presentation, with a history of progressive pulmonary failure secondary to emphysema, hypertension, and left kidney malignancy.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal aunt has distal muscle weakness; mother shows no obvious muscle weakness.
